meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were an adumbration of the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: The old man's dreams often served as adumbrations of future events.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller's adumbration of my future was both exciting and nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of thunder was an adumbration of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop in temperature was an adumbration of the winter ahead.

meanings.sent1: The artist's painting was merely an adumbration of the beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent2: The blurry photograph was a poor adumbration of the actual scene.
meanings.sent3: The child's drawing was a cute adumbration of their family.
meanings.sent4: The rough sketch was an adumbration of the final masterpiece to come.
meanings.sent5: The shadow puppet was a simple adumbration of the intricate story being told.

meanings.sent1: The adumbration of the tall building cast a shadow over the park.
meanings.sent2: The dense fog created an adumbration over the entire city.
meanings.sent3: The magician's adumbration of the rabbit made the audience gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were an adumbration over the sunny landscape.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches created an adumbration on the ground below.
